required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pemetrexed/Carboplatin Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Elderly Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Trial Pemetrexed Carboplatin as First Line Chemotherapy for Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) in Elderly Patients

brief_summary.textblock: A phase II study to evaluate the efficacy and safety profile of the combination of Pemetrexed and Carboplatin in elderly patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Complete or Partial Tumor Response (Overall Tumor Response)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured objective tumor response (up to six 21-day cycles)
primary_outcome.description: Tumor response is defined as the percentage of patients with either a complete response or a partial response. Response was determined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions and Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to stopping treatment (up to six 21-day cycles)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment. Time to treatment failure was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit for patients who did not discontinue early, who were still alive, and who have not progressed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 14.5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.

secondary_outcome.measure: Estimated Probability of One Year Progression-free Survival
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease or death, 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Progression free survival (PFS) is the duration from enrollment until first disease progression or death. For patients not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who do not have progressive disease, PFS is censored at the last radiological assessment date.

arm_group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles. Carboplatin: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

intervention.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles
Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pathologically confirmed Non Small Cell Lung Cancer Stage IIIb (not amenable to radiotherapy treatment) or Stage IV
- No previous chemotherapy for lung cancer
- Men and women > or = 70 years
- At least one uni-dimensionally measurable lesion (Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors [RECIST]criteria)
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status 0 to 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval
- Serious systemic disorders
- Inability to discontinue administration of aspirin or anti-inflammatory non steroid
- Concurrent administration of any other antitumor therapy
- Brain metastasis

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles. Carboplatin: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles. Carboplatin: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

measure.title: Disease Stage
measure.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body).

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

class.title: Other: Indifferencied Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Complete or Partial Tumor Response (Overall Tumor Response)
outcome.description: Tumor response is defined as the percentage of patients with either a complete response or a partial response. Response was determined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions and Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured objective tumor response (up to six 21-day cycles)
outcome.population: Patients qualified for tumor response analysis: treated patients, with measurable advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) disease and at least one tumor assessment after the patient received at least a first cycle of chemotherapy (unless early progression occurs, including early clinical progressions confirmed by the assessment committee).

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles. Carboplatin: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Complete or Partial Tumor Response (Overall Tumor Response)
measure.description: Tumor response is defined as the percentage of patients with either a complete response or a partial response. Response was determined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions and Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
measure.population: Patients qualified for tumor response analysis: treated patients, with measurable advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) disease and at least one tumor assessment after the patient received at least a first cycle of chemotherapy (unless early progression occurs, including early clinical progressions confirmed by the assessment committee).

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment. Time to treatment failure was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit for patients who did not discontinue early, who were still alive, and who have not progressed.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to stopping treatment (up to six 21-day cycles)
outcome.population: All treated patients. 29 patients were censored.

measurement_list.measurement: Confidence interval is not calculable for the upper limit due to the immaturity of the data.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 14.5 months)
outcome.population: Twenty patients were censored as they were still alive at the time of the data cut-off.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles. Carboplatin: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
measure.population: Twenty patients were censored as they were still alive at the time of the data cut-off.

outcome.title: Estimated Probability of One Year Progression-free Survival
outcome.description: Progression free survival (PFS) is the duration from enrollment until first disease progression or death. For patients not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who do not have progressive disease, PFS is censored at the last radiological assessment date.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease or death, 1 year
outcome.population: Six patients were censored as they had not experienced a qualifying event (death or first disease progression) at the time of data cut-off.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
